results.title: Simmo, the man I love
results.brief_description: John’s reputation as a great pilot earned him the respect of his colleagues, especially one admirer, Yolanta. But towards the end of his career, it felt like he was losing his touch, something was wrong. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

results.title: Rain check on Christmas
results.brief_description: A father and his daughter re-tell the events that happened two days before Christmas, when the father was struck down with a heart attack. Made as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.

results.title: Slow Service
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour, silent
results.brief_description:
‘Slow Service’ is a series of portraits shot using a high speed video camera. This camera, which is normally used for filming mine detonations, science experiments and military tests, captures 1000 frames a second. The footage, when played back at 25 frames per second, has been slowed down so that a second of real time takes forty seconds on the screen. ‘I asked the subjects to pose as if for a passport photograph. We see the transition between this artificial pose and their natural instinctive reaction to the bucket of food that is being thrown at them, and then the impact of the food itself.

I liked the idea of capturing a wasteful, slapstick, human gesture using a medium that is normally reserved for ‘serious’ scientists and bomb designers’. (Marcus Lyall, 2004)

results.title: Red line
results.brief_description: Carlton - ‘Imagine if there was a red line behind you’. Short narrative work presenting personal story from Carlton and Parkville. This film is an excerpt from ‘Stories from the hidden city’, a project conceived and directed by Bagryana Popov, 2000-2002.

results.title: reLOCATED - Mr and Mrs Kemp
results.brief_description: Kensington - this short film is created from a series of photographs and interviews with Mr and Mrs Kemp, residents of the Kensington Public Housing estate for 38 years. ‘reLOCATED’ documents the lives of residents from the estate who were moved when the estate was redeveloped. It is a visual record of how places contain the memories of people’s lives as well as a fantastic example of how you can use non-video media to make a powerful moving image story.

results.title: Saturn's return
results.creator_credit: Helen Pankhurst, Christos Tsiolkas and Wenona Byrne
results.brief_description: ‘Saturn’s return’ is part of an SBS commissioned series called ‘Hybrid Life’, which explores the experience of second and third generation migrants. Barney and his lover Dimi set out on a road trip to visit Barney’s father who is dying of AIDS and has decided to end his life. Based on a short story by Christos Tsiolkas and directed by Wenona Byrne, the film uses the road movie journey as a means to travel through Australia’s chequered history, while the two lovers confront their families turbulent past.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Helen Pankhurst, Christos Tsiolkas and Wenona Byrne

results.title: Phantom
results.brief_description: This video work is a mysterious, ghostly geography of cinematic shadows. Silhouettes that never quite take shape shift and glide across the screen, anaemic figures, seen in the negative, forced to wander between narratives restlessly but caught in a loop. These remnants from faint memories of filmic melodrama are a living dead confined to a space they cannot leave. They are the secret that lies between stories.
